intro: Cyrtoceras micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered cyrtoceras, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic, contributing to its medicinal uses in traditional practices. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in woodland areas across its native range in Southeast Asia. Cyrtoceras micranthum is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its potential pharmacological properties.
